channel.title: Blogs on Brandon Liang
channel.description: Recent content in Blogs on Brandon Liang

item.title: Returning to Yu-Gi-Oh
item.description: Last modified on: 2022-08-22 I got back into Yu-Gi-Oh! recently with the iOS release of Master Duel and have built three different decks for competitive play. The highest tier I’ve made it to as of this writing is Platinum I (after Diamond rank update). Swordsoul Tenyi TODO D/D/D “D/D/D” stands for Different Dimension Daemon. Taste the power of demon kings that have conquered different dimensions. It’s an incredibly hard deck to master, and I still am in the process of doing so.

item.title: Co-op Duels: 2022
item.description: Co-op Duels: 2022 Last modified on: 2022-09-30 Read the 2021 prequel [here] Northeastern has a co-op program where upperclassmen spend 4-8 months working full-time instead of taking classes for a semester, here’s how it went during my junior year. I interned as a software engineer at Snowflake in Boston working on diagnostics reporting, followed by Duolingo in Pittsburgh working on speech recognition, followed by Meta in NYC working on augmented reality headsets.

item.title: Semester Abroad in Switzerland
item.description: The town of Lucerne During the Fall 2021 semester, I studied computer science as an exchange student at the University of Zürich and a special student at ETH Zürich in Switzerland. Here’s how it went. (Most of this content is readapted from my exchange experience report, thanks goes to my friend Elaine for helping me edit this.) Preparing Accepted for a exchange! I applied to UZH through Northeastern’s Global Experience Office.

item.title: Co-op Duels: 2021
item.description: Co-op Duels: 2021 Last modified on: 2022-08-22 Northeastern has a co-op program where upperclassmen spend 4-8 months working full-time instead of taking classes for a semester, this is how it went during my sophomore year. Some people opt for one long co-op, some break it up into two (me), and some even three. I interned as a software engineer at MathWorks working on the MATLAB engine, followed by Microsoft working on the Azure cloud computing platform, respectively.

item.title: My First Post!
item.description: I decided to migrate from my old website to a blog on the Hugo engine, since I feel like writing to capture my unconventional college experience. My university friend Josh also gave me some great advice to change to a minimalistic website as I’d get tired of the design less easily.
